ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Hindi grammar, fluency, listening comprehension, and oral proficiency.
I gained a lot of knowledge of Hindi grammar, and skill speaking in Hindi.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This course was good for learning Hindi, but it could've been better in terms of improving Hindi vocabulary and understanding documents and speech by native speakers. I think having a larger component of the class be speaking in Hindi and reading/watching/listening to Hindi media would improve the course.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, to any student wishing to begin studying Hindi or who wishes to improve their Hindi, this is a fantastic language course at the University.
I would, with the caveat that you need to take initiative on your own to take full advantage of the course; what you put in is what you get.
